entry.title: Cultivating Victory: Sutherlin FFA wins state soils competition
entry.summary: PRINEVILLE — On Oct. 20, 12 Sutherlin FFA members competed in the state soils competition. Sutherlin soil’s team placed first, and they will be heading to nationals in the spring.

entry.title: Neewollah Parade, believed to be longest running in the country, returns Friday
entry.summary: The concept of a Neewollah parade may not have started in Roseburg, but the local tradition is believed to be the longest-running in the country.

author.name: GLORIA COLEMAN and ERICA REYNOLDS The News-Review

entry.title: Overwhelming demand strains Roseburg food pantry as SNAP deadline approaches
entry.summary: FISH of Roseburg Food Pantry typically serves 1,000 to 1,200 families a month. But due to growing concerns over the November 1st deadline to fund SNAP benefits, they served more than 800 families last week alone.

entry.title: Roseburg Grocery Outlet offers discount to combat potential SNAP pause
entry.summary: As the federal shutdown threatens SNAP funding, Roseburg’s Grocery Outlet is offering a 10% discount to SNAP users through November and hosting food drives to support local families. Owners Stephen and Kelly Burton say it’s their way of helping neighbors make ends meet during tough times.
